meanings.definition: Load (something) into a device or machine in advance.
meanings.sent1: Before starting the game, make sure to preload all the necessary files.
meanings.sent2: I always preload my favorite songs onto my phone before going on a long trip.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to preload the ingredients for the next day's special dish to save time.
meanings.sent4: She likes to preload her mind with positive thoughts before facing a challenging situation.
meanings.sent5: To ensure smooth playback, preload the video before watching it.

meanings.definition: The amount of force or tension applied to something before it is used or subjected to a load.
meanings.sent1: The spring's preload determines how much force it can exert when compressed.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic adjusted the preload on the suspension to improve the car's handling.
meanings.sent3: The preload on the bowstring was crucial for the archer's accuracy in hitting the target.
meanings.sent4: The preload on the trigger made the gun more sensitive to touch.
meanings.sent5: The preload on the diving board made the jump feel more powerful.
